title: balenaDash
text:
We’ve been having fun building our web-app display project this month, with the aim to get you up and running with a cool desktop display that will show any webpage in under 30 minutes. We’ve created full tutorial and partnered with our friends at PiSupply to get a good deal on all the hardware you need in one package.

Take a look at the blog post and have a go yourself, we’d love to see what use cases you come up with. We’ll be developing this further so let us know if there are any features you’d like to see.

title: DIY 6-card Etcher Flasher
text:
Whilst we are busy working hard on our EtcherPro project to solve the problem of flashing a lot of SD cards simultaneously, an Etcher user by the name of Daniel Chote @dchote shared with us their awesome DIY 6-card SD card flasher.

Daniel has written a tutorial and shared all the 3D models on Thingiverse so you can make your own. Be sure to let us both know if you do.

title: Documentation
text: Since our rename, we’ve been working hard to revamp a lot of our documentation and get everything up to date. If you notice anything missing or incorrec please let us know by adding an issue on Github or even better, by submitting a pull request. We’re committed to making our documentation as awesome as it can be - we welcome any and all feedback.

title: Connecting to Eduroam and other 802.1X networks
text: Alex Bucknall, a colleague of ours, has written a guide to connecting balenaOS devices to networks with 802.1X authentication as is common in educational institutions. BalenaOS uses the network manager tool nm to manage networking interfaces and the guide covers everything you need to connect and authenticate with these networks.
